Description: Foot and wall fragment probably from the pedestal a large East Greek pottery bowl or the like; small, square foot and carinated wall; interior reserved; exterior, cream slip; diagonal lines on outside of foot; on lower wall, scroll pattern with leaves between metopal bands of double verticals and squares; every other square has a reserved X at the centre; above the carination a broad band.
Curator's comments: 'G' in pencil on the inside. The piece is admittedly large to be from a pedestal foot, though there are several very big bowls and kraters from Naukratis, a bowl would have been glazed on the inside. A smaller parallel is 1886,0401.1053.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.577)
